gurmukhi: XO bru lY kY iSvw qy pRsMn clI huie ic`q ] sXMdn pY cV mn ibKY cih sRI jdupiq im`q ]1991]
transliteration: Yau Bar(u) Lai Kaai Shivaa Te Prasann Chalihue Chitt|| Syaandan Pai Chad Man Bikhai Chah(i) Srijadoupat(i) Mitt||1991||
translation: After getting this boon from Chandika, and being pleased, she mounted on her chariot; and went back considering Krishna as a friend in her mind.1991.

gurmukhi: cVI jwq huqI soaU sXMdn pY biRjnwiek diRSit ibKY kir kY ] Aru SqRn sYn inhwr GnI iqh qy nhI sXwm BnY fir kY ]
transliteration: Chadijaat Houtisooo Syandan Pai Brijnaaik Drishttee Bikhai Kar9i) Kai|| Ar(u) Shatran Sain Nihaar Ghanitih Te Nahisyaam Bhanai Dar(i) Kai||
translation: Abiding Krishna in her mind, she mounted on her chariot and went back and seeing the large army of the enemies she did not utter the name of Krishna from her mouth;

gurmukhi: pRB Awie pirE iqh m`iD ibKY ieh lyq ho ry iem au`cir kY ] bl Dwr leI rQ BIqr fwr murwr qbY bhIXw Dir kY ]1992]
transliteration: Prabh Aae Pario Teeh Maddh(i) Bikhai Eh Let Ho Re Im Ouchchar(i) Kai|| Bal Dhaar Lairath Bheetar Daar Muraar Tabai Baheeyaa Dhar(i) Kai||1992||
translation: At the same time, Krishna reached there and he shouted the name of Rukmani and catching her by her arm, he put her in his chariot with this strength.1992.

gurmukhi: fwr rukMmn sXMdn pY sB sUrn so ieh BwNiq sunweI ] jwq ho ry ieh ko Ab lY ieh kY rukmY Ab dyKq BweI ]
transliteration: Daar Roukanman Syandan Pai Sabh Sooran So Eh Bhaant(i) Sounaaee|| Jaat Ho Re Eh Ko Ab Lai Eh Kai Roukmai Ab Dekhat Bhaaee||
translation: Taking Rukmani in his chariot, Krishna said within, the hearing of all the warriors, “I am taking her away even within the sight of Rukmi,

gurmukhi: paurK hY ijh sUr ibKY soaU Xwh Cfwie n mwNf lrweI ] Awj sBo mirho tirho nhI sXwm BnY muih rwm duhweI ]1993]
transliteration: Paurakh Hai Jih Soor Bikhai Sooo Yaah Chhadaae Na Maand Laraaee|| Ooj Sabho Mariho Tariho Nahisyaam Bhanai Muhe Raam Duhaaee||1993||
translation: “And anyone who has the audacity, he may now rescue her by fighting with me; I shall kill all today, but shall not swerve from this task.”1993.

gurmukhi: XO bqIXw suin kY iqh kI sB Awie pry Aiq kRoD bFY kY ] ros BrY Bt Tok Bujw kib sXwm khY Aiq kRoDq hÍY kY ]
transliteration: Yau Bateeyaa Soun(i) Kai Tih Kisabh Aae Dare At(i) Krrodh Badhai Kia|| Ros Bdarai Bhat Thok Bhujaa Kabi Syaam Kahai At(i) Krodhat Hvai Ki||
translation: Hearing these words of Krishna, all of them got infuriated and patting their arms, in great anger, fell upon him;

gurmukhi: Byr GnI Shnwie iSMgy rn duMdB Aau Aiq qwl bjY kY ] so jdubIr srwsn lY iCn bIc dey jmlok pTY kY ]1994]
transliteration: Bher Ghanishahnaae Shinge Ran Doundabh Au At(i) Taat Bajai Kai|| So Jadoubeer Saraasan Lai Chhin Beech Dae Jamlok Padhhai Kai||1994||
translation: All of them attacked Krishna playing their clarionets, kettledrums, small drums and war-trumpets; and Krishna taking his bow and arrows in his hands, despatched all of them to the abode of Yama in an instant.1994.

gurmukhi: jo Bt kwhU qy nYk trY nih so irs kY iqh swmuih Awey ] gwl bjwie bjwie kY duMdB ijau Gn swvn ky Ghrwey ]
transliteration: Jo Bhat Kaahoo Te Naik Darai Nah(i) So Ris Kai Tih Saamuh(i) Aae|| Gadl Bajaae Kai Doundabh Jio Ghan Saavan Ke Ghahraae||
translation: The warriors fearing none and playing on their drums and chanting war-songs came before Krishna like the clouds of Sawan;

gurmukhi: sRI jdubIr ky bwn Cuty n itky pl eyk qhwN Thrwey ] eyk pry hI krwhq bIr blI iek AMq ky Dwm isDwey ]1995]
transliteration: Srijadoubeer Ke Baan Chhoute Na Tike Pal Ek Tahan Thahraae|| Ek Dare Hikaraahat Beer Baliik Ant Ke Dhaam Sidhaae||1995||
translation: When Krishna discharged his arrows, they could not stay before him even for an instant; someone is groaning, while lying on the earth and someone is reaching the abode of Yama after dying.1995.
